item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Informational Briefing on Hollister Ranch Coastal Access Program
subitem_blurb: Santa Barbara County. (KH/SC/LL-SF)

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: (KH/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Draft Sustainability Principles
subitem_blurb: Staff briefing on the draft document “Sustainability Principles,” which is available for public review and comment. The document is intended to provide the Commission with a set of guiding principles and next steps to reduce greenhouse gas emissions through land use policy and permitting decisions. (BC-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

item_title: Consent Cease and Desist Order No. CCC-23-CD-01 (1205-1207 Wooster Street LLC and Henri Levy, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles Co.)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed administrative action authorizing and ordering  1205-1207 Wooster Street LLC, as record owner of property located at 16701 Via La Costa, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles County (“Property”), to: 1) return the Property to its pre-violation condition by opening the public parking lot and making it available for public use, and by cleaning the restrooms and surrounding areas of the Property; 2) comply with the existing CDP for development on the Property, as amended, by complying with the requirement to transfer the Property to the City of Los Angeles or a not-for profit entity approved by the Commission’s Executive Director at no cost to the receiving entity; and 3) dismiss the Commission from pending litigation regarding the Trailhead Property, and dismiss the quiet title claim in that litigation. (HJ-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: County of Del Norte LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-DNC-21-0053-1 (Crescent City Harbor Segment Comprehensive Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by County of Del Norte to comprehensively update the regulations for the Crescent City Harbor Port Land Use Plan and Harbor-Specific Implementation Program. (CM-A)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-DNC-22-0071 (Evans, Del Norte Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Friends of Del Norte from Del Norte County decision granting permit with conditions to Connie Evans to construct a new two-story single-family residence with a 2,395-square-foot footprint and peak height of 30 feet, onsite wastewater treatment system, and onsite domestic well on an undeveloped lot at 210 Lakeside Loop adjacent to the Lake Earl Wildlife Area, approximately 5 miles north of Crescent City, Del Norte County. (TLG-A)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-MEN-23-0001 (Carson, Mendocino Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Ray and Loraine Duff from Mendocino County decision granting permit with conditions to Julia Carson to renovate an existing single-family residence, construct a guest cottage, add decking, install a generator, and temporarily occupy the guest cottage during renovation, at 45380 Caspar Point Rd., Caspar, Mendocino County. (TRG-A)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. subitem_title: City of Pacifica LCP Amendment Number LCP-2-PAC-20-0036-1 (City of Pacifica LUP Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Pacifica to comprehensively update the LCP Land Use Plan (JKN/OR – SF)

subitem_title: City of Half Moon Bay LCP Amendment Number LCP-2-HMB-21-0078-2 (Short Term Rentals and Home Occupations)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Half Moon Bay to amend the LCP Implementation Plan to establish new short-term rental provisions and to update existing home occupation standards. (SR-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Pismo Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-PSB-22-0012-1 (SB 9)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by City of Pismo Beach to modify its LCP to implement Senate Bill 9 related to lot splits and residential density allowances. (SM-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Capitola LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CAP-22-0060-2 Part A (Zoning Code Updates).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Capitola to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to conduct a zoning code cleanup is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-SCO-23-0003 (Cauwels Armoring, Santa Cruz Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Thomas Mader and Commissioners Escalante and Hart from Santa Cruz County decision granting CDP to Mark and Suzanne Cauwels to recognize shoreline armoring on the coastal bluff adjacent to Geoffroy Drive, including slope stabilization, drainage infrastructure, and related development previously authorized under County Emergency CDP at 70 Geoffroy Drive in the Live Oak area of Santa Cruz County. (NC-SC) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

At the conclusion of the Commission meeting or at 5:00 p.m., whichever is later, on Wednesday, March 8, 2023, the Commission will visit the Pillar Point Harbor West Trail Living Shoreline site, 1 Johnson Pier, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019.  A reception will follow at Old Princeton Landing restaurant, 460 Capistrano Rd, Half Moon Bay, CA. Members of the public are welcome to attend. Please note: This is a social event for the Commission and the public. No lobbying, distribution of materials, signage, or other communication about Commission business should occur at the event. Thank you.

At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0549 (Newport Dunes Resort and Marina, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Newport Dunes Resort and Marina to replace in kind two public launch ramp docks, each consisting of 1,458 sq.ft. and each supported by two, 11-in. round pipe piles; existing piles will be re-used in place, located at 1131 Back Bay Drive, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0806 (Homes, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Thomas James Homes to remove 160 sq.ft. floating dock, 3-ft. x 19-ft. gangway, two 12-in. square concrete marina guide piles and 32 sq.ft. pier supported by two 12-in. pier piles ; install 160 sq.ft. floating dock, 3-ft. x 24-foot gangway, and two 12-in. square concrete marina guide piles, located at 4014 Channel Place, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0968 (Fluter, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Russ Fluter to remove 393 sq.ft. pier and ten 14' square piles and replace with new 253 sq.ft. dock system and three 14' square piles in new locations, at 751 Via Lido Soud, Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0603 (Maat Investments, LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Maat Investments, LLC for development to: 1) reinforce bulkhead by installing four new tie-backs connecting to 2 new concrete deadman; 2) replace 5-ft. x 31.5-ft. deck cantilevered from bulkhead like-for-like; and 3) increase height of seawall to 10.9 ft. NAVD88, all associated with single-family home, located at 62 Linda Isle, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0959 (Loews Coronado Bay Resort and California State Parks Beach Hut, Coronado)
subitem_blurb: Request by Loews Coronado Bay Resort and California State Parks to temporarily place beach hut in the public parking lot and chairs/umbrellas on the beach, and provide limited food/beverage service during the summer for hotel guests and the public, at Silver Strand State Beach, Coronado, San Diego County. (ML-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0962 (Olson, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Ethan Olson to construct 2-story, 25 ft.-high, 2,850 sq. ft., single-family home, with detached 3-car garage, and new perimeter fences along rear and side property lines on vacant lot at 216 16th St, Seal Beach, Orange County. (VL-LB)

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Notice of Impending Development No. UCS-NOID-0001-23 (West Storke Wetland)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by the University of California Santa Barbara to restore 0.5 acres within the West Storke Wetland, on the Storke Campus at the University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (SF-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0607 (Grandview Real Estate Investments, LLC, Venice)
subitem_blurb: Application of Grandview Real Estate Investments, LLC to redevelop one story,1,212 sq.ft. single-family home resulting in 27 ft.-high, 2-story, 2,190 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 317 sq.ft. 2-car garage and roof deck at 29 27th St., Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (ES-LB)

item_title: DEPUTY DIRECTOR’S REPORT for ENERGY, OCEAN RESOURCES and FEDERAL CONSISTENCY
item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-22-0219 (DCOR, LLC., Orange County)
subitem_blurb: Application by DCOR, LLC., for after-the-fact authorization to install repair clamps to seal an oil leak on 8-in. diameter offshore pipeline (line 0919) approx. 1-mile offshore of Bolsa Chica State Beach, Orange County, and associated mobilization, inspection, and seafloor work; and provide payment of funds to address civil liabilities. (JB– SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-22-0060 (City of Laguna Beach, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark and Sharon Fudge from City of Laguna Beach Decision granting to City of Laguna Beach for demolition of existing sewer lift station, installation of new sewer lift station, stairway reconstruction, Anita Street end improvements, landscaping, and installation of permanent lifeguard tower at Westerly Terminus of Anita Street, Public-Right-of-Way, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (BW-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. A-5-LGB-22-0025 (Gray, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Mike & Lori Gray to construct two-story, 30’ high, 3,552 sq.ft. single-family home and attached 489 sq.ft. garage at 1007 Gaviota Dr., Laguna Beach, Orange County. (BW-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. A-5-HNB-21-0031 (Signal Landmark, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Signal Landmark for archaeological grading and monitoring activities at 2.5-acre vacant site at 17202 Bolsa Chica Street (east side of Bolsa Chica St., south of Los Patos Ave) in Huntington Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0579 (Gasparini, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Robert & Marilyn Gasparini to add 912 sq. ft. of living space on first and second floor of 25 ft.-high, 2-story, single-family home, add new deck and covered patio, construct new pool, and restore rear yard with native vegetation on canyon-top lot at 328 W Avenida Gaviota, San Clemente, Orange County. (VL-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0738 (Orange County Water District, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Orange County Water District to bore and install two single-point monitoring wells to facilitate investigation of saltwater intrusion into coastal freshwater aquifers. Drill rig, pipe trailer with drill pipe, mud tank, and shaker unit will be used to advance 10-in.- to 15-in.- diameter boreholes to respective depths of 160 ft. and 250 ft. below ground surface at two chosen locations within existing asphalt parking lot of Seal Beach Naval Weapons Station at 911 Seal Beach Blvd., Seal Beach, Orange County. (SA-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Oceanside LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-OCN-21-0077-2 (Coast Highway Incentive District)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Oceanside to amend its certified Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to facilitate redevelopment along Coast Highway. (TR-SD)

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-22-0052-2 (Zoning Cleanup 2022). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of Carlsbad to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to provide consistency with state law, resolve inconsistencies, codify interpretations and department policies, and improve usability of the code. (CB-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-22-0053-2 (Housing Element Program Implementation). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of Carlsbad to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to implement programs outlined in the Carlsbad Housing Element. (CB-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0064-3 (Community Planning Group Reform). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program to amend the Land Development Code regarding the operation and project review authority of community planning groups. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0127 (LHO Mission Bay Hotel, LP, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of LHO Mission Bay Hotel, LP to rebrand Paradise Point Resort, remodel and reconfigure various retail, dining, office structures, construct public access improvements, construct 8 new guest rooms, redevelop 8 guest rooms, and address alleged Coastal Act violations by constructing public restrooms, providing $250,000 worth of value to a Science Education and Family Vacation Program for Underserved Students over 5 years, and implementing a Marine Debris Reduction Plan, at 1404 Vacation Road, Mission Bay Park, San Diego. (AL-SD) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: City of Redondo Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-RDB-22-0048-2
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Redondo Beach to amend the Implementing Ordinances (IP) portion of the certified LCP to update cannabis regulations, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment.(DZ-LB)

subitem_title: City of Long Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LOB-21-0089-3-Part B (Unpermitted Dwelling Units, Motel/Hotel Conversions).
